name: Fractured Cereal Quiz | Fractured Food | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Raisin Bran.

	Raisin Bran was created by Kellogg. The name of the cereal can not be trademarked by anyone due to the fact that the words are commonly used. Raisin Bran is grossly high in sugar due to the sugared raisins, but high in iron and vitamin A.

Kix.

	Kix was created by General Mills in 1937. The cereal is a puffed grain circle made from corn. Kix is high in vitamin A, calcium, and iron.

Freakies.

	Freakies was the first cereal put out by a company called Ralston. When the Ralston company changed managers, several different kinds of Freakies was put on the shelves including Fruity Freakies and Cocoa Freakies. Freakies cereal was used in two movies in the late eighties. The cereal was discontinued in 1976 after only being on the shelves four years. Freakies was high in iron, but also high in sugars.

Cream of Wheat.

	Cream of Wheat is a porridge style breakfast food that is served hot. It first came to the United States in 1893 through Grand Forks, North Dakota. It was originally made in Europe where it was known as a semolina porridge. Cream of Wheat is a high carbohydrate that is rich in iron and vitamins A and B6.

Corn Flakes.

	Corn Flakes was created in 1907 by Kellog. Corn Flakes was created by accident when two brothers left out some wheat that went stale over time. Not wanting to throw it out, they used the wheat in rollers to make dough. Instead of dough, the stale wheat came out of the rollers in flakes. A patent for the cereal was accepted on April 14, 1896. Corn Flakes is high in iron and vitamin A, however, the downside of this cereal is that it is also high in sodium.

Just Right.

	Just Right is a Kellogg's cereal. It was developed for health conscious people. The cereal contains wholewheat, corn, and raisins. Just Right is high in vitamin B6 and B12.

Fruity Pebbles.

	Fruity Pebbles is one of many brand names for Post Cereal. Fruity Pebbles came out in 1969. The cereal is gluten and cholesterol free and is high in vitamin D and vitamin A.

Total.

	Total cereal was distributed by General Mills in 1961. It was an assembly of whole grain wheat flakes that was high in calcium, iron, and vitamin B.

Golden Grahams.

	Golden Grahams is a General Mills cereal made with whole wheat and mixed with brown sugar and honey. It was developed in the 1970's. Golden Grahams is high in iron and in sugars.

Wheaties.

	Wheaties was created by General Mills in 1924. It is considered the breakfast of champions. Wheaties came to be by accident when a vat of oat bran fell onto a hot stove causing the oat bran to crack into pieces. Wheaties is high in fiber and iron.
